glsa.title: Xen: Privilege Escalation
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in Xen's bundled QEMU version might allow privilege escalation.

description.p: In CIRRUS_BLTMODE_MEMSYSSRC mode the bitblit copy routine cirrus_bitblt_cputovideo fails to check wethehr the specified memory region is safe.

impact.p: A local attacker could potentially execute arbitrary code with privileges of Xen (QEMU) process on the host, gain privileges on the host system, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: Running guests in Paravirtualization (PV) mode, or running guests in Hardware-assisted virtualizion (HVM) utilizing stub domains mitigate the issue.
Running HVM guests with the device model in a stubdomain will mitigate the issue.
Changing the video card emulation to stdvga (stdvga=1, vga=”stdvga”, in the xl domain configuration) will avoid the vulnerability.
